page.title: 11HEALTH IN SOUTHREPPS
page.content: A large proportion of villagers are pensioners including a number over 8O years of age. Most are able to reside and maintain their own homes whilst some receive care from neighbours, health officials, home helps and church members. Handicapped children and young people needing special training are taken daily to the Holt Training Centre. A Doctor's surgery is held weekly at Ham House for those preferring not to make the journey to nearby towns. Surgery provides consultation and medicines. Voluntary Car Service provides trans- port to hospital, dentist, optician, etc. Vicar visits people resident in local old peoples homes, hospitals, etc. There is a baby sitting circle and keep fit class. Jogging is popular.
